collaborate.translation[0].definitions[0: to work together with a person or group in order to achieve something, especially in science or art
The two nations are collaborating on several satellite projects.
During the late seventies, he collaborated with the legendary Muddy Waters.
Researchers are collaborating to develop the vaccine.
Elephants collaborate in looking after their young.
In everyday English, people usually say they work together on something rather than collaborate on something:
They are working together on some new songs.
collaborate.translation[0].definitions[1: to help a country that your country is fighting a war with, especially one that has taken control of your country
Vigilantes began combing the city for anyone known to have collaborated with the enemy.
collaborate.translation[1].definitions[0: to work together with another person, company, or organization to achieve something
Firms are collaborating with other firms to spread rising research and development costs.
They will collaborate on a series of research projects.
